jx.jx_en_mean: study (a subject) intensively, especially in preparation for something
jx.jx_cn_mean: 强化学习，（尤指为准备某事而）用功学习

lj.lj_ly: teachers spend their evenings swotting up on jargon.
lj.lj_ls: 教师们晚上强化学习行话。

lj.lj_ly: I've always been interested in old furniture and I've swotted it up a bit.
lj.lj_ls: 我一直都对老式家具感兴趣，并且集中学习了一些有关的知识。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: dialect variant of sweat

entry.tran: (尤指为准备考试)刻苦学习，用功
entry.def: If you swot, you study very hard, especially when you are preparing for an examination.

example.ex: They swotted for their A levels.
example.tran: 他们为准备高级程度考试而刻苦学习。

entry.tran: 只知一味用功学习的人;书呆子
entry.def: If you call someone a swot, you disapprove of the fact that they study extremely hard and are not interested in other things.

means.word_mean: 1. an insignificant student who is ridiculed as being affected or studying excessively
1. study intensively, as before an exam;

sentences.sentence: "I had to bone up on my Latin verbs before the final exam"
